PreToolUse.matcher: tool == "Bash" && tool_input.command matches "(npm run dev|pnpm( run)? dev|yarn dev|bun run dev|go run|air)"

hooks.command:
#!/bin/bash
input=$(cat)
cmd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_input.command // ""')

# Block dev servers that aren't run in tmux
echo '[Hook] BLOCKED: Dev server must run in tmux for log access' >&2
echo '[Hook] Use this command instead:' >&2

if echo "$cmd" | grep -qE 'go run|air'; then
  echo "[Hook] tmux new-session -d -s backend 'go run cmd/api/main.go'" >&2
  echo '[Hook] Then: tmux attach -t backend' >&2
else
  echo "[Hook] tmux new-session -d -s frontend 'npm run dev'" >&2
  echo '[Hook] Then: tmux attach -t frontend' >&2
fi
exit 1

PreToolUse.description: Block dev servers outside tmux - ensures you can access logs

hooks.command:
#!/bin/bash
input=$(cat)
if [ -z "$TMUX" ]; then
  echo '[Hook] Consider running in tmux for session persistence' >&2
  echo '[Hook] tmux new -s dev  |  tmux attach -t dev' >&2
fi
echo "$input"

PreToolUse.description: Reminder to use tmux for long-running commands

hooks.command:
#!/bin/bash
# Block creation of unnecessary documentation files
input=$(cat)
file_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // ""')

if [[ "$file_path" =~ \.(md|txt)$ ]] && [[ ! "$file_path" =~ (README|CLAUDE|AGENTS|CONTRIBUTING)\.md$ ]]; then
  echo "[Hook] BLOCKED: Unnecessary documentation file creation" >&2
  echo "[Hook] File: $file_path" >&2
  echo "[Hook] Use README.md for documentation instead" >&2
  exit 1
fi

echo "$input"

PreToolUse.description: Block creation of random .md files - keeps docs consolidated
Suggest manual compaction at logical intervals

SessionStart.description: Load previous context on new session

hooks.command:
#!/bin/bash
# Auto-detect PR creation and log useful info
input=$(cat)
cmd=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_input.command')

if echo "$cmd" | grep -qE 'gh pr create'; then
  output=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_output.output // ""')
  pr_url=$(echo "$output" | grep -oE 'https://github.com/[^/]+/[^/]+/pull/[0-9]+')
  
  if [ -n "$pr_url" ]; then
    echo "[Hook] PR created: $pr_url" >&2
    echo "[Hook] Checking GitHub Actions status..." >&2
    repo=$(echo "$pr_url" | sed -E 's|https://github.com/([^/]+/[^/]+)/pull/[0-9]+|\1|')
    pr_num=$(echo "$pr_url" | sed -E 's|.*/pull/([0-9]+)|\1|')
    echo "[Hook] To review PR: gh pr review $pr_num --repo $repo" >&2
  fi
fi

echo "$input"

PostToolUse.description: Log PR URL and provide review command after PR creation

hooks.command:
#!/bin/bash
# Run gofmt and goimports after editing Go files
input=$(cat)
file_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // ""')

if [ -n "$file_path" ] && [ -f "$file_path" ]; then
  echo "[Hook] Running gofmt on $file_path" >&2
  
  # Run gofmt
  if command -v gofmt >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    gofmt -w "$file_path" 2>&1 | head -5 >&2
  fi
  
  # Run goimports if available
  if command -v goimports >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "[Hook] Running goimports on $file_path" >&2
    goimports -w "$file_path" 2>&1 | head -5 >&2
  fi
fi

echo "$input"

PostToolUse.description: Auto-format Go files with gofmt and goimports after edits

hooks.command:
#!/bin/bash
# Warn about fmt.Println in production Go code
input=$(cat)
file_path=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // ""')

if [ -n "$file_path" ] && [ -f "$file_path" ]; then
  # Check for fmt.Println or fmt.Printf (not in test files)
  println_usage=$(grep -n "fmt\\.Print" "$file_path" 2>/dev/null || true)
  
  if [ -n "$println_usage" ]; then
    echo "[Hook] WARNING: fmt.Print* found in $file_path" >&2
    echo "$println_usage" | head -5 >&2
    echo "[Hook] Use structured logging (slog/zap) instead" >&2
    echo "[Hook] Example: slog.Info(\"message\", \"key\", value)" >&2
  fi
fi

echo "$input"

PostToolUse.description: Warn about fmt.Println in production Go code (suggest slog/zap)

hooks.command:
#!/bin/bash
# Final check for console.logs in modified frontend files
input=$(cat)

if git rev-parse --git-dir > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  # Check frontend files for console.log
  frontend_files=$(git diff --name-only HEAD 2>/dev/null | grep -E 'frontend/.*\.(ts|tsx|js|jsx)$' || true)
  
  if [ -n "$frontend_files" ]; then
    has_console=false
    while IFS= read -r file; do
      if [ -f "$file" ]; then
        if grep -q "console\.log" "$file" 2>/dev/null; then
          echo "[Hook] WARNING: console.log found in $file" >&2
          has_console=true
        fi
      fi
    done <<< "$frontend_files"
    
    if [ "$has_console" = true ]; then
      echo "[Hook] Remove console.log statements before committing" >&2
    fi
  fi
  
  # Check Go files for fmt.Println
  go_files=$(git diff --name-only HEAD 2>/dev/null | grep -E '\.go$' | grep -v '_test\.go$' || true)
  
  if [ -n "$go_files" ]; then
    has_println=false
    while IFS= read -r file; do
      if [ -f "$file" ]; then
        if grep -q "fmt\.Print" "$file" 2>/dev/null; then
          echo "[Hook] WARNING: fmt.Print* found in $file" >&2
          has_println=true
        fi
      fi
    done <<< "$go_files"
    
    if [ "$has_println" = true ]; then
      echo "[Hook] Use structured logging (slog/zap) instead of fmt.Print*" >&2
    fi
  fi
fi

echo "$input"

Stop.description: Final audit for console.log (frontend) and fmt.Print* (Go) before session ends
